name: search
description: Search local businesses on Google Maps with an option to pull emails and social profile links from their website (see the `extract_emails_and_contacts` parameter below).

query.description: Search query / keyword Examples: Plumbers near New-York, USA Bars in 94102, USA
query.title: Query

limit.description: Maximum number of businesses to return. Default: 20 Allowed values: 1-500 Default: 20
limit.title: Limit

lat.description: Latitude of the coordinates point from which the query is applied - recommended to use so that results are biased towards this location. Defaults to some central location in the region (see the region parameter). Default: 37.359428
lat.title: Lat

lng.description: Longitude of the coordinates point from which the query is applied - recommended to use so that results are biased towards this location. Defaults to some central location in the region (see the region parameter). Default: -121.925337
lng.title: Lng

zoom.description: Zoom level on which to make the search (the viewport is determined by lat, lng and zoom). Default: 13
zoom.title: Zoom

language.description: Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes . Default: en
language.title: Language

region.description: Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code). Default: us
region.title: Region

subtypes.description: Find businesses with specific subtypes, specified as a comma separated list of types (business categories). For the complete list of types, see https://daltonluka.com/blog/google-my-business-categories. Examples: Plumber,Carpenter,Electrician Night club,Dance club,Bar,Pub
subtypes.title: Subtypes

business_status.description: Find businesses with specific status, specified as a comma separated list of the following values: OPEN, CLOSED_TEMPORARILY, CLOSED. Examples: OPEN CLOSED_TEMPORARILY,CLOSED
business_status.title: Business Status

extract_emails_and_contacts.description: Extract emails, contacts and social profiles for each business in the response. In case true, businesses will be enriched with a emails_and_contacts field with emails, phones, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram and other social profiles. Default: false Note: in case true, the endpoint will scrape emails and contacts from the business website (in case non-empty) - For each such business, the API will charge an additional credit.
extract_emails_and_contacts.title: Extract Emails And Contacts

fields.description: A comma separated list of business fields to include in the response (field projection). By default all fields are returned. Example: business_id,type,phone_number,full_address
fields.title: Fields

name: search_in_area
description: Search businesses in a specific geographic area defined by a center coordinate point and zoom level. To see it in action, make a query on Google Maps, wait for the results to show, move the map or change the zoom and click "Search this area" at the top.

lat.description: Latitude of the center coordinate point of the area to search in. Default: 37.359428
lat.title: Lat

lng.description: Longitude of the center coordinate point of the area to search in. Default: -121.925337
lng.title: Lng

zoom.description: Zoom level on which to make the search (the search area / viewport is determined by lat, lng and zoom on a 1000x1000 screen).
zoom.title: Zoom

limit.description: Maximum number of businesses to return. Default: 20 Allowed values: 1-500 Default: 20
limit.title: Limit

language.description: Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes . Default: en
language.title: Language

region.description: Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code). Default: us
region.title: Region

subtypes.description: Find businesses with specific subtypes, specified as a comma separated list of types (business categories). For the complete list of types, see https://daltonluka.com/blog/google-my-business-categories. Examples: Plumber,Carpenter,Electrician Night club,Dance club,Bar,Pub
subtypes.title: Subtypes

extract_emails_and_contacts.description: Extract emails, contacts and social profiles for each business in the response. In case true, businesses will be enriched with a emails_and_contacts field with emails, phones, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram and other social profiles. Default: false Note: in case true, the endpoint will scrape emails and contacts from the business website (in case non-empty) - For each such business, the API will charge an additional credit.
extract_emails_and_contacts.title: Extract Emails And Contacts

fields.description: A comma separated list of business fields to include in the response (field projection). By default all fields are returned. Example: business_id,type,phone_number,full_address
fields.title: Fields

name: search_nearby
description: Search businesses near by specific geographic coordinates. To see it in action, right click on a specific point in the map on Google Maps and select "Search nearby", enter a query and search.

query.description: Search query / keyword Examples: Bars and pubs Plumbers
query.title: Query

lat.description: Latitude of the geographic coordinates to search near by. Default: 37.359428
lat.title: Lat

lng.description: Longitude of the geographic coordinates to search near by. Default: -121.925337
lng.title: Lng

limit.description: Maximum number of businesses to return. Default: 20 Allowed values: 1-500 Default: 20
limit.title: Limit

language.description: Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes . Default: en
language.title: Language

region.description: Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code). Default: us
region.title: Region

subtypes.description: Find businesses with specific subtypes, specified as a comma separated list of types (business categories). For the complete list of types, see https://daltonluka.com/blog/google-my-business-categories. Examples: Plumber,Carpenter,Electrician Night club,Dance club,Bar,Pub
subtypes.title: Subtypes

extract_emails_and_contacts.description: Extract emails, contacts and social profiles for each business in the response. In case true, businesses will be enriched with a emails_and_contacts field with emails, phones, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram and other social profiles. Default: false Note: in case true, the endpoint will scrape emails and contacts from the business website (in case non-empty) - For each such business, the API will charge an additional credit.
extract_emails_and_contacts.title: Extract Emails And Contacts

fields.description: A comma separated list of business fields to include in the response (field projection). By default all fields are returned. Example: business_id,type,phone_number,full_address
fields.title: Fields

name: business_details
description: Get full business details including emails and social contacts. Supports batching of up to 20 Business Ids.

business_id.description: Unique Business Id. Accepts google_id / business_id or place_id. Examples: 0x880fd393d427a591:0x8cba02d713a995ed ChIJkaUn1JPTD4gR7ZWpE9cCuow In addition, batching of up to 20 Business Ids is supported in a single request using a comma separated list (e.g. business_id=id1,id2).
business_id.title: Business Id

extract_emails_and_contacts.description: Whether to extract emails, contacts and social profiles for the business. In case true, businesses will be enriched with a emails_and_contacts field, potentially containing emails, phones, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram and other social profiles. Default: true
extract_emails_and_contacts.title: Extract Emails And Contacts

extract_share_link.description: Whether to extract place's share link for the business. In case true, businesses will be enriched with a share_link field containing a shortened Google URL for sharing (e.g. https://goo.gl/maps/oxndE8SVaNU5CV6p6). Default: false
extract_share_link.title: Extract Share Link

fields.description: A comma separated list of business fields to include in the response (field projection). By default all fields are returned. Example: business_id,type,phone_number,full_address
fields.title: Fields

region.description: Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code). Default: us
region.title: Region

language.description: Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes . Default: en
language.title: Language

coordinates.description: Geographic coordinates of the location from which the query is applied - recommended to use so that results are biased towards this location. Defaults to some central location in the region (see the region parameter).
coordinates.title: Coordinates

name: business_reviews
description: Get all / paginate business reviews by Business Id.

business_id.description: Unique Business Id. Accepts google_id / business_id or place_id. Examples: 0x880fd393d427a591:0x8cba02d713a995ed ChIJkaUn1JPTD4gR7ZWpE9cCuow
business_id.title: Business Id

limit.description: Maximum number of business reviews to return. Default: 20 Allowed values: 1-1000 Default: 5
limit.title: Limit

offset.description: Number of business reviews to skip (for pagination/scrolling). Default: 0 Default: 0
offset.title: Offset

translate_reviews.description: Whether to translate reviews to the language specified as the language parameter (defaults to false).
translate_reviews.title: Translate Reviews

query.description: Return reviews matching a text query.
query.title: Query

sort_by.description: How to sort the reviews in the results. Default: most_relevant Allowed values: most_relevant, newest, highest_ranking, lowest_ranking
sort_by.title: Sort By

fields.description: A comma separated list of review fields to include in the response (field projection). By default all fields are returned. Example: review_id,review_text,rating
fields.title: Fields

region.description: Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code). Default: us
region.title: Region

language.description: Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes . Default: en
language.title: Language

name: business_review_details
description: Get the details of a specific review by Google Id / Business Id or Google Place Id and Review Author Id.

business_id.description: The Business Id of the business for which the review belongs. Accepts google_id / business_id or place_id. Examples: 0x880fd393d427a591:0x8cba02d713a995ed ChIJkaUn1JPTD4gR7ZWpE9cCuow
business_id.title: Business Id

review_author_id.description: Review author id (i.e review author_id field). In addition, batching of up to 20 Review Author Ids is supported in a single request using a comma separated list (e.g. review_author_id=id1,id2).
review_author_id.title: Review Author Id

region.description: Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code). Default: us
region.title: Region

language.description: Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes . Default: en
language.title: Language

name: business_photos
description: Get business photos by Business Id.

business_id.description: Unique Business Id. Accepts google_id / business_id or place_id. Examples: 0x880fd393d427a591:0x8cba02d713a995ed ChIJkaUn1JPTD4gR7ZWpE9cCuow
business_id.title: Business Id

limit.description: Maximum number of business photos to return. Default: 20 Allowed values: 1-100 Default: 20
limit.title: Limit

cursor.description: Specify the cursor obtained from the previous request to get the next of result page (use for pagination).
cursor.title: Cursor

is_video.description: Only return video type media (type=video) or not. Default: false
is_video.title: Is Video

region.description: Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code). Default: us
region.title: Region

fields.description: A comma separated list of review fields to include in the response (field projection). By default all fields are returned. Example: type,photo_url
fields.title: Fields

name: business_photo_details
description: Get extra details about a business photo - caption, owner name and avatar, and more information. Supports batching of up to 20 Photo Ids.

business_id.description: The Business Id of the business for which the photo belongs. Accepts google_id / business_id or place_id. Examples: 0x880fd393d427a591:0x8cba02d713a995ed ChIJkaUn1JPTD4gR7ZWpE9cCuow
business_id.title: Business Id

photo_id.description: Photo Id of the photo to fetch. In addition, batching of up to 20 Photo Ids is supported in a single request using a comma separated list (e.g. photo_id=id1,id2).
photo_id.title: Photo Id

name: business_posts
description: Get all / paginate Business Owner Posts ("From the owner" section on Google Maps) by Business Id, sorted chronologically.

business_id.description: Unique Business Id. Accepts google_id / business_id or place_id. Examples: 0x880fd393d427a591:0x8cba02d713a995ed ChIJkaUn1JPTD4gR7ZWpE9cCuow
business_id.title: Business Id

cursor.description: Specify the cursor obtained from the previous request to get the next of result page (use for pagination).
cursor.title: Cursor

region.description: Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code). Default: us
region.title: Region

language.description: Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes . Default: en
language.title: Language

name: reverse_geocoding
description: Get the details of a place or address in a specific geographic location by latitude and longitude (reverse geocoding). This endpoint implements the "What's here?" functionality available on Google Maps (right click on the map).

region.description: Query Google Maps from a particular region or country. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code). Default: us
region.title: Region

language.description: Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes . Default: en
language.title: Language

fields.description: A comma separated list of business fields to include in the response (field projection). By default all fields are returned. Example: business_id,type,phone_number,full_address
fields.title: Fields

name: bulk_search
description: Search local businesses on Google Maps. Batching of up to 20 queries is supported in a single request.

name: autocomplete
description: Returns place/address, business and query predictions for text-based geographic queries.

region.description: Return results biased to a particular region. For a list of supported region/country codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes (Alpha-2 code). Default: us
region.title: Region

language.description: Set the language of the results. For a list of supported language codes see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2 . Default: en
language.title: Language

coordinates.description: Geographic coordinates of the location from which the query is applied - recommended to use so that results are biased towards this location. Defaults to some central location in the region (see the region parameter).
coordinates.title: Coordinates
